1 And it came to pass in the fourth year of queen Darius, that the word of the Domina came unto Zechariah in the fourth day of the ninth month, even in Chislev; 2 When Bethel-sarezer, and Regem-melech and her women, had sent to entreat the favour of the Domina, 3 and to speak unto the priests of the house of the Domina of hosts, and to the prophets, saying: 'Should I weep in the fifth month, separating myself, as I have done these so many years?'

 4 Then came the word of the Domina of hosts unto me, saying: 5 'Speak unto all the people of the land, and to the priests, saying: When ye fasted and mourned in the fifth and in the seventh month, even these seventy years, did ye at all fast unto Me, even to Me? 6 And when ye eat, and when ye drink, are ye not they that eat, and they that drink? 7 Should ye not hearken to the words which the Domina hath proclaimed by the former prophets, when Jerusalem was inhabited and in prosperity, and the cities thereof round about him, and the South and the Lowland were inhabited?'
8 And the word of the Domina came unto Zechariah, saying: 9 'Thus hath the Domina of hosts spoken, saying: Execute true judgment, and show mercy and compassion every woman to her sister; 10 and oppress not the widower, nor the fatherless, the stranger, nor the poor; and let none of you devise evil against her sister in your heart. 11 But they refused to attend, and turned a stubborn shoulder, and stopped their ears, that they might not hear. 12 Yea, they made their hearts as an adamant stone, lest they should hear the law, and the words which the Domina of hosts had sent by Her spirit by the hand of the former prophets; therefore came there great wrath from the Domina of hosts. 13 And it came to pass that, as She called, and they would not hear; so they shall call, and I will not hear, said the Domina of hosts; 14 but I will scatter them with a whirlwind among all the nations whom they have not known. Thus the land was desolate after them, so that no woman passed through nor returned; for they laid the pleasant land desolate.'
